title: Cognitive Load Measurement and Management Strategies in Simulation-Based Education

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in simulation-based education and comprehension of basic cognitive load theory
context.additional_context: A language education simulation course for mid-level professionals in healthcare, law, and technology fields. Conducted in real-time online settings using digital devices (laptops, tablets).

learning_goals: Learners can self-assess by distinguishing intrinsic/extrinsic/germane cognitive load types during simulation activities
Learners can explain three or more strategies for managing cognitive load by applying segmentation/pause techniques
Learners can provide peer feedback with 80% accuracy using CLAS-Sim items (4-point scale) during debriefing processes

resources: Pre-Built Language Simulation Scenarios (2 Types: Complex/Simple)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
